values:
i am so ready to go home. i am at the point that i just want to give up and quit, but then i don't want to do that because i will regret the things that i could have done and did not do them. i do not have a lot on my proverbable plate but it sure feel like it at times, i try keep my head up and keep pushing forward. if anyone has any advice feel free to give it to me.

thanks for all the help
bill

i am not sure why today is a bad day but it is. nobody really put me in a depressed mood but i am. i emailed all of my fathers, ron, ray, & rich asking them for some fatherly advice i have not received anything yet from them, but i sure that they will reply. 

i am to the point where i will try not to cry unless i am alone. i think that it show weakness towards my peers. i feel the tears coming now and i am trying hard to not let them fall. it is hard but i can do it. i really that kristie was with me so i could just cry on her shoulder, that would make it better i think. 

i really wish that i had a good friend on the boat like i had at sewell's point. someone like angie downing and kara lampley. they were sisters to me, they were there when i really a friend to talk to when i did not want to bother kristie with my problems, i know that if it was really bad they would have told her everything. i know that kristie is always there for me, but sometimes i just need the special person to talk to. 

i wish that christina had not moved to CT, but that was her choice. she is that one person that might get to see me cry. i really need a close friend to talk to. yeah i have friends onboard, but none that i trust to share my feelings with. 

i need the love of my loving wife so i can make love to her. i just want lay there with her and just be there with her until the day that i die....not her. she is the rock that i lean on. she has been there for me since Feb 11, 1993. that was the day that we met. even though i picked her last to dance i found it hard to resist being with her, she made me what i am today. 

i had a breakdown in 2001, she was there for me. i first went to angie, but she was there for the duration. she was the one that helped me through it. i have been with one other woman, but she does not compare to kristie. i have introduced her to robin. i think that they are friends but i am not totally convinced.

i have gotten a lot off my chest. 

thanks for listening

over the past couple of weeks has been kinda rough, i have been in the engineering spaces "helping them" with painting. as you know i hate painting. today was the straw that broke the camel back so to speak, this week i am in berthing cleaning it for the XO inspection at 1000. i made a bad decision today, i just went to the main spaces and not to berthing, i got my ass chewed off by HMCS, i got real upset to the point that i almost started to cry and say the hell with this and just go hide for real. i am still kind of upset about it but not as much. after dinner and after HMCS hada chance to cool off he talked to me as a man not a little kid, that is what i admire about him the most, he never dwells on my bad decisions, he discusses the problems later and that tells me that he really does care about my career, sometimes i wonder if i care about my career. i think he cares more about it than i do at times. 

i am glad that kris and christina told me about this live journal thing it really helps at times. just to vent and to get things off my chest that i really do not want to share with fellow shipmate. today was one of those days that i wished that i had someone to talk to like my friends angie downing and/or kara lampley, i needed to talk but i had nobody to talk to which did not really help. i know that kris and chirstina will read this and give their advice and opinions on how i should fix this, i appreciate them for that but sometimes i need that one special friend to talk to.

i am done venting for today. thanks for listening.

love me

Today is holiday routine, which means no real work got done....LOL. i had flight quarter all night long. i woke up at about 2pm or 1400. i helped with the bingo for the fundraiser for the tsunami victims. we raised $800. 

hags, tross, ream, and i have decided to start our plotting on HMCS tomorrow. h has gotten me twice and hags once. i came up with a weekly outline that we will go by, this way we can plan out our every move so as not to get caught. i think that he will have just as much fun receiving as we do giving....LOL. 

over the past 2+ years he has taught me alot about being a leader and a better corpsman. i will be getting my ESWS pin no later than march. i have about 80-85% of my book signed off. i will be taking the test in mid to late febuary. that is the only goal i have yet to achieve and i will achieve it. i will not leave here as a HM2 i WILL leave here as a HM2(SW). i have worked too hard to just say fuck it and not get it. i should have gotten it on the USS Simpson FFG56, it was a smaller ship this way all i would have to do is requal on a few systems and get qualified on some new systems.

well i will add more later..love me

this seems to be the only way to send info to you.

well, another year has past, in my boring life. i have been gone for too long.

kris email me when you read this

tonight is the first new years eve that i have not been home in 12 years. i have been working in the engineering space this past week, it was ok. i had a stressful week, but being in the engine room gave me a chance to relieve some stress by needle gunning. 

i had to counsel some junior shipmates, i have only been able to counsel one of them so far. the first one started getting upset but i was talking to him with his LPO, which was a good thing. i will talk to the other one sunday with is LPO. i think that he will be angry as well. 

i hope all that read this understand where i am coming from

love bill

TODAY IT WAS A VERY BAD MORNING, IT STARTED OFF BAD, I AM NOT SURE WHY IT DID, BUT IT DID. IT DID GET BETTER THOUGH I THINK. BY THE END OF THE DAY I HAD A VERY MASSIVE HEADACHE, I HAVE FLIGHT QUARTER TONIGHT TOO.

TODAY I HAD TO COUNSEL A SHIPMATE ON HORSEPLAY AROUND THE HELO HANGER AND HE WAS NOT VERY HAPPY. I LEFT HIM WITH HIS LPO AND LET HIM DEAL WITH IT AFTER THAT. I WAS JUST LETTING HIM KNOW WHAT I THOUGHT ABOUT HIS ACTIONS.

WE, AS IN MEDCIAL, CLEANED SICKBAY AND THE HEAD. HMCS BOUGHT A STEREO TODAY. 

DON'T HAVE MUCH MORE TO SAY OTHER THAN I LOVE AND MISS HER VERY MUCH. I HOPE THAT SHE READS THIS AND SEES I REALLY DO LOVE HER. 

BILL

HELLO EVERYONE,

this is my first entry in here. the past 2 days have been rather busy, i was put on the tiger that is assisting the engineers get ready for the MCA in March i will be working on this team for about 6-8 weeks. it has its advantages and disadvantages. i really am not complaining just venting, i think that is bullshit to have other divisions assist with thier spaces. 

kris is a little depressed with me, i have not called her but i will call her next week at least once a day. i need to hear her voice as well as me needing to hear her voice. i hope that everything goes well with the CPS. i am a little worried but i am very optimistic, so i think that everything will work out in the end. 

i am hitting the ESWS classes very hard, i want to take the test by the end of Jan or early Feb and have my board by med Feb. i will have my pin before i get back from this cruise. this way i can take the HM1 test in Sept 06. i really don't think that i will make it on the first time up but i will give it a good shot and i head up a study group at my house once a week. this way i can socialize and study at the time.


nothing else to enlighten you with.

bill
